column4: can someone briefly explain to me about ubuntus package installer. i'm use to fedora using yum
thanks
go to System > Admin > synaptic package manager
i'm not sure if mail-notification uses ssl (which google requires)
you must enable ssl in your pop3 clients for it to work with google
there is a very good walkthrough when you log into gmail using your browser
i am not sure if the applet uses ssl
a google mail tray applet?
where do you get it?
i'll compile it in a second
yes, it's vaporware atm
sudo fdisk -l
the dog sent you a link
to mount all the drives on your box
xdiskusage
i dont know of any mail apps with panel notification
write a panel dockling for one
can you explain that or refer me to some doc.
i'm not a programmer, but all the mail apps are open-sourced and have 'hooks' for you to 'call' functions
so theoretically one would create a dockling, or panel applet which called the running email client and kept count of unread mails or whatever you wanted to make it do
there is "mail-notification" but it istn part of any mail app
i believe there is a "google mail" section in mail-notification
ah
